verses.text: “O Lord, I am shamed and hesitant before Your face.
parts: “O Lord, I am shamed and hesitant before Your face.

verses.text: For our sins abound far above our heads, and our ignorance has risen up to heaven.
parts: For our sins abound far above our heads, and our ignorance has risen up to heaven.

verses.text: From the time of our fathers until this day, we are in great sin.
parts: From the time of our fathers until this day, we are in great sin.

verses.text: Because of our iniquities and those of our fathers, we with our brothers, our kings, and our priests were handed over to the kings of the earth, to the sword, to captivity, to foraging, in shamefulness until this very day.
parts: Because of our iniquities and those of our fathers, we with our brothers, our kings, and our priests were handed over to the kings of the earth, to the sword, to captivity, to foraging, in shamefulness until this very day.

verses.text: “Now how great is the mercy that has come to us from You, O Lord!
parts: “Now how great is the mercy that has come to us from You, O Lord!

verses.text: to unveil a light to us in the house of our Lord and God and to give us food in the time of our captivity.
parts: to unveil a light to us in the house of our Lord and God and to give us food in the time of our captivity.

verses.text: Even in our servitude we were never forsaken by our Lord, but He gave us favor with the kings of Persia,
parts: Even in our servitude we were never forsaken by our Lord, but He gave us favor with the kings of Persia,

verses.text: who gave us food and honored the temple of our Lord.
parts: who gave us food and honored the temple of our Lord.

verses.text: “So now, what are we to say, O Lord, since we have these things?
parts: “So now, what are we to say, O Lord, since we have these things?

verses.text: ‘The land into which you are entering as an inheritance is a land made unclean by the defilement of the foreign peoples of the land, for they have filled it with their impurity.
parts: ‘The land into which you are entering as an inheritance is a land made unclean by the defilement of the foreign peoples of the land, for they have filled it with their impurity.

verses.text: Thus, you are not to give your daughters in marriage to their sons, nor take their daughters for your sons.
parts: Thus, you are not to give your daughters in marriage to their sons, nor take their daughters for your sons.

verses.text: Never seek to live in peace with them, that you may be strong and partake of the good things of the land, giving it to your children as an inheritance forever.’
parts: Never seek to live in peace with them, that you may be strong and partake of the good things of the land, giving it to your children as an inheritance forever.’

verses.text: “Everything that happened to us came about because of our evil works and our many sins.
parts: “Everything that happened to us came about because of our evil works and our many sins.

verses.text: You, O Lord, lightened the burden of our iniquities and gave us so great a root.
parts: You, O Lord, lightened the burden of our iniquities and gave us so great a root.

verses.text: Were You not furious with us to destroy us until there was no root left, nor a seed, nor our name?
parts: Were You not furious with us to destroy us until there was no root left, nor a seed, nor our name?

verses.text: You are faithful, O Lord of Israel, for we were left as a root to this very day.
parts: You are faithful, O Lord of Israel, for we were left as a root to this very day.

verses.text: Behold, we are now before You in our lawlessness, for because of this there is no place for us to stand before You.”
parts: Behold, we are now before You in our lawlessness, for because of this there is no place for us to stand before You.”

verses.text: As Ezra was praying and giving thanks, weeping and prostrate on the ground before the temple, a very large crowd gathered around him—men, women, and young men from Jerusalem—for there was great lamentation among the people.

verses.text: Let us swear an oath to the Lord in this, to put away all our foreign wives with their children, as decided by you and by as many as obey the law of the Lord.

verses.text: Stand up and complete this task; for it is in your hands, and we are with you to take firm action.”

verses.text: Now therefore, make your confession and glorify the Lord God of our fathers.
parts: Now therefore, make your confession and glorify the Lord God of our fathers.

verses.text: Do His will and be separate from the peoples of the land and from your foreign wives.”
parts: Do His will and be separate from the peoples of the land and from your foreign wives.”

verses.text: Then all the people cried out and said with a loud voice, “Thus as You have said, we will do.

author: Uncertain. The authorship of this book is debated, since it appears to contain some of Ezra's memoirs, and yet parts of 2 Chronicles and Nehemiah are found in the text.
date: About 150 BC, and not later than 100 BC since Josephus used the LXX version in his Antiquities of the Jewish People (AD 93–94)
theme: Major Themes—The restoration of temple worship in Jerusalem and renewed commitment to the Law of Moses
